DataElement.preferredName: First MI Fatal Coronary Disease Event Since Enrollment Coded Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Coded indicator for Yes (1) or No (0) to represent occurrence of the first event of myocardial infarction (gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area) or fatal coronary heart disease (CHD) since the time that an individual was enrolled on a research study, independent of prevalent disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: First Myocardial Infarction Fatal Coronary Disease Event Since Enrollment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Reference to first event of myocardial infarction (gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area) or fatal coronary heart disease (CHD) since the time that an individual was enrolled on a research study.

ObjectClass.preferredName: First Myocardial Infarction Fatal Coronary Disease Event
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area. (Dorland, 27th ed):No value exists.:An imbalance between myocardial functional requirements and the capacity of the coronary vessels to supply sufficient blood flow. It is a form of MYOCARDIAL ISCHEMIA (insufficient blood supply to the heart muscle) caused by a decreased capacity of the coronary vessels.:Event; something that happens at a given place and time.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis.

Narrowing of the coronary arteries due to fatty deposits inside the arterial walls. The diagnostic criteria may include documented history of any of the following: documented coronary artery stenosis greater than or equal to 50% (by cardiac catheterization or other modality of direct imaging of the coronary arteries); previous coronary artery bypass surgery (CABG); previous percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI); previous myocardial infarction. (ACC)
Something that happens at a given place and time.

Property.preferredDefinition: Subsequent to; after.:Enrollment; to insert, register, or enter in a list, catalog, or roll. (Merriam-Webster Online)

Concepts.definition: The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Coded numeric indicators for Yes (1) or No (0)  in answer to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary):A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
